A significant step down from Half-Life 2, but still an alright expansion. The first and final acts are good but repetitive, punctuated with the occasional great high point  - not too bad at all. What really brings Episode One down however is the middle section set within a series of headcrab infested ruins. I can only assume this was Valve trying to hit two birds with one stone: A. attempting to recapture Ravenholm while also B. getting in on some of that Doom 3 horror. Unfortunately it just doesn't work. 

There are several long sections with no fixed light sources whatsoever, forcing you to rely solely on your flashlight (which somehow seems to die even faster here) and setting enemies alight with the flares and gas cans scattered around the area. It sounds like it may be an interesting spin on the usual Half-Life 2 gameplay loop, but in reality it's incredibly frustrating and you can tell that Half-Life 2 wasn't designed for this. Even when Doom 3 threw you into pitch black environments you were very rarely facing off more than a few enemies at once with the main challenge being navigation, whereas Episode One has you up against far more. In additon, the enemies in Doom 3 were designed so that light was emitted when enemies spawned in and fired projectiles to give players that brief glimpse their surroundings which really helped in those situations - None of this foresight is present here, because the game wasn't designed to be dark like Doom 3 was... Hell, Id Software revolutionised dynamic lighting to be able to get away with being so dark.

Overall, it's alright. Just please, for god sake Half-Life, don't try to be Doom 3 ever again.

The level design feels like an expansion of Half-Life 1, which is definitely not a bad thing. A pretty short expansion to the base game, and the last segment is quite poorly paced and executed, but the rest is up to the usual Valve standard.

In my ongoing and likely futile effort to write a Steam review for every game in my library (#172 out of 555)... it's time for Half-Life 2: Episode One.

Not sure why Valve expects anyone to jump into an episodic Half Life game when they abandoned it after only two episodes, and seem to have zero plans to continue the story. I'm certain the level design and gunplay is all very compelling, but as I've said several times over the course of this review-writing campaign, I need a bit more from my games. I need, in a word, context. Story, that is. A reason to care is a reason to play. And just knowing that this whole thing is going to be unresolved absolutely kills my motivation to play it.

Episodic games have become rather trendy in recent years, and I can think of no greater example than Half Life -- developed by one of the most successful development studios in gaming history, with far greater resources than almost anyone else in the industry -- to justify never, ever, ever buying an episodic game until the whole series is completed.
A fun and short edition to the Half-Life series

Další pokračovaní o travne,začatek hrozny,ta hra kdyby začal hrat až od druhe misi,myslim jak konečne dostanete zbraně.Tuhle hru udělal debil,dvě hodiny hazeni kouly,radší si zahrají baskedball,než tohle.Později se to trožku rozjelo,to auto se nepovedlo,hruza radší need for speed než tohle,dvě hodiny jezdit rachotině.Pavouci otravni,pak časem je ovladate,ještě větší blbost,pavouci vas pořad blokují,hop hod kouly až mužeš jit,idijot to vymyslel.Neřikam že pořad,ale dost často.Tu hru si tak jednou zahrat a už nikdy vic.Ta hra mohla byt lepší,je odflakla.Konec taky hrozny,promě ta hra skončila na naměsti,když jsem zničil ty vysoke roboty,jak jsem jich zabyl 6,tak to byl promě konec hry.Konec jsem jim vubec nepovedl,strašne moc otravny.

[h1]Half-Life 2: Episode one é um jogo de ação que continua em City 17, que é a ultima localização que se passa no jogo anterior[/h1]

Olha tenho que confessar que nunca tinha jogado o episódio 1 antes e rapaz... excelente, primeiro porque achei as fases muito bem elaboradas e a história desse jogo apesar de ser relativamente simples, por ser apenas o protagonista Gordon Freeman e a Alyx tentando escapar de City 17 tornou o jogo bastante curto, mas em compensação fez eu me divertir bem mais que o próprio Half-Life 2 anterior.

As conquistas também são muito fáceis e daria pra zerar em 1 jogatina mas só se a pessoa tiver consciência do que fazer. 
No meu caso eu acabei dando apenas uma olhada rápida e fui naquela ideia de tentar pegar o 100%, porém dei molhe na parte do reator e matei um Stalker e avancei sem perceber sendo tarde demais, o que impediu meu 100%. Enfim concluindo esse jogo seria perfeito pros platinadores, só que fica de olho nas conquistas pra não dar o mesmo molhe que eu dei =)

[b]Vale a pena comprar?[/b]
Sim. O jogo é muito bem elaborado, você como Freeman e sempre tendo a Alyx pra ajudar fez também toda a diferença, então acho que a única coisa negativa que esse jogo teria é o fato dele ser bastante curto, isso não é problema pra mim.
Logo se você tiver procurando uma diversão rápida e achar o preço razoável, pode comprar!!
Best of the best.

HL2:EP1紧接着HL2本体的结尾，讲述了弗里曼和艾利克斯并肩杀出CITY17的故事。剧情长度约为本体的1/5，不过节奏很紧凑，推荐游玩。

最后说下游玩时配合成就“一弹逃出术”一起做。要求只开一枪通关，不过可以用重力枪、撬棍、手雷和火箭筒。总体难度中等，不是很难。唯一要开的一枪是在第一次拿到手枪和霰弹枪的黑屋子里，用手枪打坏铁门的锁即可。此后流程都可以用重力枪配合火箭筒杀敌，另外大部分时间还有无敌的艾利克斯在身边保护你，你大可以站在她身后等她帮你清敌。
Это самая крутая игра, мне не надоест в неё играть даже в 2100 году.
